itemDescription: English rugby union and rugby league footballer

wikipedia_page.main: Ephraim Curzon (first ¼ 1883 – death unknown) was an English soldier, and rugby union and professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1900s and 1910s. He played representative level rugby union (RU) for British Army Rugby Union, and at club level for Carlisle RFC[1][2], Lismore RFC[3] (in Edinburgh), and Kirkcaldy RFC[4] (in Fife), and representative level rugby league (RL) for Great Britain and Lancashire, and at club level for Salford, as a forward (prior to the specialist positions of; prop, hooker, second-row, loose forward), during the era of contested scrums.

response: * Ephraim Curzon (born ), English soldier and rugby footballer
